elevator.rmi.impl
Class MotorsImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--elevator.rmi.impl.MotorsImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Motors, java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
public class MotorsImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Motors

The MotorsImpl class implements the remote interface elevator.rmi.Motors used for controlling all motors of elevators via RMI. An object with the MotorsImpl class is created to control all motors at once or a group of motors or one motor of one elevator. The elevator.rmi.Motors interface can be used to start moving the elevator(s) up or down, to stop the elevator(s) and to get a current position(s) of the elevator(s). The getMotors() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the elevator.rmi.Motors object. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
     Motors motors = MakeAll.getMotors();
     motors.up(); // move all elevators up
     motors.stop(1); // stop the first elevator
     if (motors.whereIs(4) < 2.888)
        motors.stop(4); // stop the 4th elevator on the 3rd floor
     int[] number = {1, 3, 5};
     int[] pos = motors.whereAre(number);
     motors.up({2, 4}); // move 2nd and 4th elevators up
     motors.move({1, 5}, {Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN});

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden

move

public void move(int[] command)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving or stop all elevators.
Specified by:
move in interface Motors
Parameters:
command - the array of commands to start moving or to stop elevators. The length of the command array must be not less than the number of elevators. A command can be either of Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN, Motors.STOP which can be alternatively specified as 1, -1, 0, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the command array is not a legal command, or the length of the command array is less than the number of elevators.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
move(int[], int[]), up(), down(), stop()

move

public void move(int[] number,
                 int[] command)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 IllegalParamException
Start moving or stop a group of elevators
Specified by:
move in interface Motors
Parameters:
number - the array of integer numbers of elevators to be moved or stopped
command - the array of commands to start moving or to stop the elevators. The length of the command array must be not less than the length of number. A command can be either of Motors.UP, Motors.DOWN, Motors.STOP which can be alternatively specified as 1, -1, 0, respectively.
Throws:
IllegalParamException - if some element in the command array is not a legal command, or some element in the number array is not a legal elevator number, or the length of the command array is less than the length of the number array.
java.rmi.RemoteException - if failed to execute
See Also:
